stories.text:
Hi, I'm currently self-studying CS following the subjects here https://teachyourselfcs.com/. I'm now reading 'Computer Networking: A Top-Down Approach'.

My flow is to simply write down notes as I go through each chapter and review them at the end of each chapter. I don't do any of the exercises, though I probably should. Recently, I've been thinking that studying CS in a group setting will be more fun.

Do you engage with other students / the writers when you read through a CS / Tech book?
stories.title: Ask HN: Engagement while reading a CS / Tech book?

stories.text:
Hi HN,

I am looking for textbooks and/or online courses that go over the Variational Bayes method systematically based on math and probability theory. I'm less interested in coding so not too keen to know Python or R packages and tutorials involving them.

I will really appreciate it if anyone who works in this area can suggest books or online courses. Even if the course is not free, that's all right. Thank you!
stories.title: Ask HN: Good resources to learn Variational Bayes method
